snippet: A week ago, at a fund-raising dinner in Beverly Hills, President Clinton said that 1998 provided Democrats with the first good opportunity in ''quite a long time'' to capture the governorship of California.    ''And believe me,'' he added, an edge...
lead_paragraph: A week ago, at a fund-raising dinner in Beverly Hills, President Clinton said that 1998 provided Democrats with the first good opportunity in ''quite a long time'' to capture the governorship of California. ''And believe me,'' he added, an edge to his voice, ''we don't need to blow it.''
abstract: Democrats are working hard to recapture Governor's office in California, since next governor will preside over redrawing of state's Congressional boundaries after 2000 census; he or she will be position to approve or veto or force compromise on whatever reapportioning plan Legislature devises for 50-plus House districts in state (S)

headline.main: Political Briefing; Positioning for 2000 At Stake in California
